I hate to say it but as a  fighting game lover who started with the mortal kombat franchise and grew up with it along with Killer Instinct , I can not recommend mortal kombat 1 on pc in its current state. There is still so much wrong with this game  and the franchise in general over the last couple of years. 

Lets start with the biggest problem with this game which is lack features and things to do in this game esp offline. I will start with the offline  part of it. The game released with literally bare bone features and game modes. You have the story that can be completed in a couple of days. You have the classic and traditional towers which will last you a bit longer but kind of gets boring versing the AI. It gives you individual character ending upon completing the  classic tower and some the character endings are kind of lame in  this game. You do have a practice mode and tutorials section and it is quite good and it does have  some advanced things it  teaches you but unless you really like the gameplay you are not going to spend a lot of time on it. And the last offline mode which  I find the most boring is a mode called the invasions mode. It replaces the krypt which was way better and more immersive. It is basically  different themed tile sets of single fights and challenges combined completed with a character of your choice and it has a top down view. There are different seasons for that mode in which you acquire different skins and rewards.  After you go through all the tile sets once you get sick of repeating it again and again for every season just to get new skins and  rewards. Instead of trying to evolve the krypt mode from previous games into an konguest third person mode and get the reward that way they replaced it with this boring mode.

Onto the online part of the  game now it lacks a lot of stuff other fighting games have . It doesn't have rooms where you can invite friends in a list and fight them one at a time and you cant just fight casually online either you have do to ranked mode  and mortal kombat's ranked system isn't very good. It doesn't separate players of different skill very well. Crossplay wasn't available at launch and you can't practice against the cpu while you wait for opponents online like in other fighting  games. On top of that performance wise the netcode and servers still have issues like de-synchs and lag.

Now onto the next  big problem with this game which is gameplay. Again NRS release their next fighting game with very little univeral mechanics esp defensive. Instead they introduced a gimmicky assist like system called the kameo system that wasn't well thought out and is just assist characters throwing out more special moves. And what makes matters worse is that it replaces the 1v1 mode so now you can't play without the kameos which hurts the games longevity even more.  Movement is yet again clunky and feels retarded.  Inputs and utility for legacy moves have been changed yet again for main roster characters because they rebuild their game from the ground up instead of building upon it like other fighting games do.  All this doesn't help when characters  either have small move lists or watered down movesets. The kameo system does add a little variety for gameplay but it shouldn't be at the expense of universal mechanics or other game modes. Overall the gameplay feels bland and repetitive, even some pros find the game boring now. There is also a balance issue with the power level of characters. NRS said they would buff the characters and add more moves but so far the patches are very small and the most changes have been done to kameos instead of the base roster characters.

The next issue with this game is yet again the roster. NRS still don't or cant go above 24 or 25 characters for their base roster and they cant help themselves overdo it with guest characters yet again that don't belong in the mk universe. There is going to be even more guest in this game than in mk11. On a good note they did add  some 3d Era characters which players were asking for like Ashrah and Li Mei which is a nice change. Also they did put a lot of the ninjas in the base roster. They now decided to make the main villain boss character Shang Shung a paid dlc which sucks instead of unlocking him in game and they removed two characters that were in the story to be dlc characters. Their models were already in game and had animations and moves. To make matters worse they made some fan favourite characters kameo assist fighters instead of fully playable base roster characters like Sonya and Jax. They are adding dlc characters to the game and some of them like Ermac and Takeda look interesting but they are accompanied by guest dlc characters also and too many of them if you ask me in a single dlc pack.

Onto the story mode and characters. The story was decent half way through but it ended up going to shit afterwards cause they decided to bring the timeline rubbish back into this game again as well as it being influenced by this multiversus DC crap which I don't find interesting at all. Also dialogue was a bit cheesy and awful in some parts. You got to see some of the characters become what they are which is nice. Some characters also got completely redesigned and had their origins changed. Some of it was ok but some of it went too far to the point where characters just lost their identity completely almost. 

Other issues in this game include overpriced micro transactions for things like classic skins stuff. Music almost being non existant or boring like in mk11. Customisation being too basic and overall  the game loosing its dark nostalgic feel it used to have.

Overall like I said I do not recommend this game esp at full price. I spent $40 Australian on this game. Don't get me wrong you will get some enjoyment out of it. Some of the characters are fun to play and story is half decent but there is just too much missing in this game or issues with this game and it has lost its soul identity as a mk game.

This game was publicized as a renewal of the series harkening back to its inception. The simpler uniforms bring it back to its origins (minus Kano and Sonya as playable characters). Then you get Kung Lao, Kitana, Milena, Baraka, etc making it like Mortal Kombat 2, which I loved to play in arcades. Also, Sindel and other characters making it more like Mortal Kombat 3, another favorite (also is like games in the middle of the Mortal Kombat series, but I never played those so the characters are new to me). MK2 was more innovative at the time, but I enjoyed 3 just as much in the 90s.

To get to the point I loved that this game came out in October. That fact and the hype made me pull the trigger. Do I think it was hyped? It was. Is it a good game? It's a fantastic game. However, due to the fact that I got MK 11 for maybe $9 with all content and MK 10 for about $5 or less with all DLC, I don't see how NRS enjoys turning it around and charging extra for the game, DLC characters, and a ludicrous price for the expansion.

I paid $70 for the game, bought the first Kombat Pack and kamoes for a very stingy discount, and now my pockets and wallet are in the same place I'm in with Street Fighter. It's a good game, just try to wait for a sale! I played it when it came out while I had Covid, and didn't touch it for months due to the large file size. Once I found out how not to get wasted every online match, I really began to love it. Some online players are jerks though, won't even let you get one punch in, same as Under Night In 
-Birth.

I want the expansion, but it's just too expensive. Lately, I'm fond of playing as Kung Lao!

The Story mode is probably the best part as it still has a solid story, but don't expect The Last of US 1 or anything its a 7/10. The problem is everything else, there is a lack of game modes, there are less characters than MK 9, 10 and 11, the customization is also lesser. I don't particularly like the addition of cameo characters, they do add another layer of depth for the game play but for most people I have spoken with they not a great addition, maybe at the higher levels of play people might like them but casuals either forget they exist of just use them as combo extenders. The long combos are still here but the tools at your disposal for defense are terrible compared to the systems in other fighting games right now. I dislike that the only way to brake out of a combo is to use your partner and that uses all of the special power, leaving you defenseless if you fall into another combo in the match. they made the grab counter a 50/50 chance for whether to press XY or AB. The point is that in this game offence is way more favored than defense which makes it feel very casual. it is less of a back and forward fight between two characters and more of "Its my turn to do my combo" than "Now it's my turn" most of your skill comes from your ability to start the combo, after that it is mostly memorization. If you like the MK franchise you will probably like this game as well, as a fan I would give this an 8/10 due to the lack of game modes and the predatory monetization with meaningless rewards. As a casual gamer I would say that its more of a 7/10 because the meat of the game is much less than in the last few games, I still think that MK10 felt better to play. MK1 is at its most enjoyable if you stick with it for a long time and master it, but then again I just think that there are a lot of other games that are more fun to master. Worth buying for $30 or less.

I've always loved MK. I played since the first one when I was a kid. 
This game has some good content. Its pretty decent if you ignore the cons. The only thing I dont like about it is the forced "diversity" for the sake of the checkbox. Its disingenuous and serves to do nothing except alienate people who are fans to pickup a few people with radical political views who likely dont play video games anyways. I will never in any way tell someone they can't play a game because of who they are. Like the game? Play it. However, when you've changed things that are hallmarks of the series for diversity points it really rubs some people the wrong way. That being said, the back catalog exists and it's better than this iteration because it doesn't contain politics.

I'm really disappointed with Mortal Kombat 1. The game costs 60 euros, and it‚Äôs absolutely not worth the money. From start to finish, it's nothing but frustration.

First of all, the game is barely playable on PC. Despite having a good system, it‚Äôs locked at 60 FPS, which is unacceptable in this day and age. Plus, the gameplay is completely unbalanced. Opponents can take you out with just two combos, ruining any fun you might have.

To anyone considering buying this game: Save your money. Use the 60 euros for a nice meal with friends or buy your partner a gift. Anything is better than purchasing this disappointing game. Mortal Kombat 1 is, unfortunately, nothing but trash.

As once a kid who played the early 2D era Mortal Kombat games, and then growing, many of the other 3D titles to follow (Deadly Alliance being my favorite), I really enjoy Mortal Kombat 1 (12)!

First off, just accept the fact that the story has been doing multiverse stuff since MK 11, and when you do, you'll have fun with it! As for the game play, I mean I am no competitive pro scene guy, but it is solid. I got the edition including the Kombat Pack 1 when it was on sale and I must say I've been happy with the game as a whole.

I also had MK11 and very much enjoyed that too, if that bit of info helps anyone.

The dumbest thing I hate about the game is the fact that Shang is locked behind his very own separate pay wall, that's fucking stupid.

Grab an edition that includes DLC when it's on sale, I think you'll be happy! Just stay away from that absurd full price no DLC base edition.
